alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 21 at 5:16AM CDT until April 24 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Trempealeau River at Dodge affecting Trempealeau and Buffalo Counties. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Trempealeau River at Dodge. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, The railroad bridge about three quarters of a mile upstream from the gage can restrict the flow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM CDT Friday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon.
